<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Represents a range of memset&#39;d bytes with the ByteVal value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This allows us to analyze stores like:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><Highlight kind="comment">///   store 0 -&gt; P+1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><Highlight kind="comment">///   store 0 -&gt; P+0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><Highlight kind="comment">///   store 0 -&gt; P+3</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><Highlight kind="comment">///   store 0 -&gt; P+2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which sometimes happens with stores to arrays of structs etc.  When we see</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the first store, we make a range &#91;1, 2).  The second store extends the range</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to &#91;0, 2).  The third makes a new range &#91;2, 3).  The fourth store joins the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><Highlight kind="comment">/// two ranges into &#91;0, 3) which is memset&#39;able.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange">MemsetRange</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Start/End - A semi range that describes the span that this range covers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The range is closed at the start and open at the end: &#91;Start, End).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a1827a631b19dc28ab5b92cce3049feb7"><Highlight kind="normal">  int64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a08bd5a766fda4d1f159d192a3b19a9f9">Start</a>, <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a1827a631b19dc28ab5b92cce3049feb7">End</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// StartPtr - The getelementptr instruction that points to the start of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// range.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a7639d343402e983c8af69e41bc09349f"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a7639d343402e983c8af69e41bc09349f">StartPtr</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Alignment - The known alignment of the first store.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#aadc57e236fba009606938fa47c46d5a1"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/maybealign">MaybeAlign</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#aadc57e236fba009606938fa47c46d5a1">Alignment</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// TheStores - The actual stores that make up this range.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a4a44fbe3e85f7b6e0b35472360721223"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">SmallVector&lt;Instruction &#42;, 16&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a4a44fbe3e85f7b6e0b35472360721223">TheStores</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#aecce23689d355fbd5be9131c29954b5d">isProfitableToUseMemset</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>) </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// end anonymous namespace</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#aecce23689d355fbd5be9131c29954b5d"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#aecce23689d355fbd5be9131c29954b5d">MemsetRange::isProfitableToUseMemset</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/datalayout">DataLayout</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>)</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we found more than 4 stores to merge or 16 bytes, use memset.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a4a44fbe3e85f7b6e0b35472360721223">TheStores</a>.size() &gt;= 4 || <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a1827a631b19dc28ab5b92cce3049feb7">End</a> - <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a08bd5a766fda4d1f159d192a3b19a9f9">Start</a> &gt;= 16)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If there is nothing to merge, don&#39;t do anything.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a4a44fbe3e85f7b6e0b35472360721223">TheStores</a>.size() &lt; 2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If any of the stores are a memset, then it is always good to extend the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// memset.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a> : <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a4a44fbe3e85f7b6e0b35472360721223">TheStores</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;StoreInst&gt;</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/si">SI</a>))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Assume that the code generator is capable of merging pairs of stores</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// together if it wants to.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a4a44fbe3e85f7b6e0b35472360721223">TheStores</a>.size() == 2)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we have fewer than 8 stores, it can still be worthwhile to do this.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// For example, merging 4 i8 stores into an i32 store is useful almost always.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// However, merging 2 32-bit stores isn&#39;t useful on a 32-bit architecture (the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// memset will be split into 2 32-bit stores anyway) and doing so can</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pessimize the llvm optimizer.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since we don&#39;t have perfect knowledge here, make some assumptions: assume</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the maximum GPR width is the same size as the largest legal integer</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// size. If so, check to see whether we will end up actually reducing the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// number of stores used.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Bytes = unsigned(<a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a1827a631b19dc28ab5b92cce3049feb7">End</a> - <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a08bd5a766fda4d1f159d192a3b19a9f9">Start</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxIntSize = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#ad467c4ab9119043f9b7750ab986be61a">DL</a>.getLargestLegalIntTypeSizeInBits() / 8;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (MaxIntSize == 0)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="normal">    MaxIntSize = 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumPointerStores = Bytes / MaxIntSize;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Assume the remaining bytes if any are done a byte at a time.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumByteStores = Bytes % MaxIntSize;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we will reduce the # stores (according to this heuristic), do the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// transformation.  This encourages merging 4 x i8 -&gt; i32 and 2 x i16 -&gt; i32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// etc.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange/#a4a44fbe3e85f7b6e0b35472360721223">TheStores</a>.size() &gt; NumPointerStores + NumByteStores;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">namespace </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetranges"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetranges/#a9bc7ad24e4fc25f232f96acf8cc235a8">MemsetRanges</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">range&#95;iterator = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl/#ac5b936169badf0b703567eb960278648">SmallVectorImpl&lt;MemsetRange&gt;::iterator</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Add a new store to the MemsetRanges data structure.  This adds a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">/// new range for the specified store at the specified offset, merging into</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">/// existing ranges as appropriate.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetranges/#aa71b518026ce2113a8281f7dd3f050d9"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetranges/#aa71b518026ce2113a8281f7dd3f050d9">MemsetRanges::addRange</a>(int64&#95;t Start, int64&#95;t <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targetlibraryinfo-cpp/#aca185e6d0e9f423dbb24440206454872a11dbf501abf829b3ab7049c2d3a8a053">Ptr</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="normal">                            <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/maybealign">MaybeAlign</a> Alignment, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;Inst) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="normal">  int64&#95;t End = Start + <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="normal">  range&#95;iterator <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a327a399b9f6ef414a29ddeffba934d26">partition&#95;point</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal">      Ranges, &#91;=&#93;(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange">MemsetRange</a> &amp;O) &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> O.End &lt; Start; &#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="209"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We now know that I == E, in which case we didn&#39;t find anything to merge</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// with, or that Start &lt;= I-&gt;End.  If End &lt; I-&gt;Start or I == E, then we need</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to insert a new range.  Handle this now.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> == Ranges.end() || End &lt; I-&gt;Start) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange">MemsetRange</a> &amp;R = &#42;Ranges.insert(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>, <a href="/docs/api/structs/anonymous-namespace-memcpyoptimizer-cpp-/memsetrange">MemsetRange</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><Highlight kind="normal">    R.Start = Start;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><Highlight kind="normal">    R.End = End;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><Highlight kind="normal">    R.StartPtr = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targetlibraryinfo-cpp/#aca185e6d0e9f423dbb24440206454872a11dbf501abf829b3ab7049c2d3a8a053">Ptr</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><Highlight kind="normal">    R.Alignment = Alignment;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><Highlight kind="normal">    R.TheStores.push&#95;back(Inst);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="222"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// This store overlaps with I, add it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;TheStores.push&#95;back(Inst);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00224" /><CodeLine lineNumber="224"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00225" /><CodeLine lineNumber="225"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// At this point, we may have an interval that completely contains our store.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="226"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If so, just add it to the interval and return.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="227"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;Start &lt;= Start &amp;&amp; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;End &gt;= End)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00228" /><CodeLine lineNumber="228"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="229"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00230" /><CodeLine lineNumber="230"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now we know that Start &lt;= I-&gt;End and End &gt;= I-&gt;Start so the range overlaps</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// but is not entirely contained within the range.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See if the range extends the start of the range.  In this case, it couldn&#39;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// possibly cause it to join the prior range, because otherwise we would have</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// stopped on &#42;it&#42;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Start &lt; I-&gt;Start) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;Start = Start;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;StartPtr = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/targetlibraryinfo-cpp/#aca185e6d0e9f423dbb24440206454872a11dbf501abf829b3ab7049c2d3a8a053">Ptr</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;Alignment = Alignment;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Now we know that Start &lt;= I-&gt;End and Start &gt;= I-&gt;Start (so the startpoint</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// is in or right at the end of I), and that End &gt;= I-&gt;Start.  Extend I out to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// End.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (End &gt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;End) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><Highlight kind="normal">    <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;End = End;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><Highlight kind="normal">    range&#95;iterator NextI = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">while</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (++NextI != Ranges.end() &amp;&amp; End &gt;= NextI-&gt;Start) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Merge the range in.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;TheStores.append(NextI-&gt;TheStores.begin(), NextI-&gt;TheStores.end());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (NextI-&gt;End &gt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;End)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><Highlight kind="normal">        <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>-&gt;End = NextI-&gt;End;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><Highlight kind="normal">      Ranges.erase(NextI);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><Highlight kind="normal">      NextI = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Simplify this once P will be determined by MSSA, in which case the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Takes a memcpy and a call that it depends on,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><Highlight kind="comment">/// and checks for the possibility of a call slot optimization by having</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the call write its result directly into the destination of the memcpy.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MemCpyOptPass::performCallSlotOptzn(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;cpyLoad,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><Highlight kind="normal">                                         <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;cpyStore, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;cpyDest,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The general transformation to keep in mind is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00847" /><CodeLine lineNumber="847"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   call @func(..., src, ...)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   memcpy(dest, src, ...)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="849"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="850"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// -&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   memcpy(dest, src, ...)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//   call @func(..., dest, ...)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Since moving the memcpy is technically awkward, we additionally check that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// src only holds uninitialized values at the moment of the call, meaning that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the memcpy can be discarded rather than moved.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can&#39;t optimize scalable types.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (cpySize.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/details/fixedorscalablequantity/#a9188f84e1dd67530330dcab9cae787d7">isScalable</a>())</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="931"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="932"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make sure that nothing can observe cpyDest being written early. There are</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="933"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// a number of cases to consider:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  1 cpyDest cannot be accessed between C and cpyStore as a precondition of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     the transform.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  2 C itself may not access cpyDest (prior to the transform). This is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     checked further below.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  3 If cpyDest is accessible to the caller of this function (potentially</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00939" /><CodeLine lineNumber="939"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     captured and not based on an alloca), we need to ensure that we cannot</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     unwind between C and cpyStore. This is checked here.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//  4 If cpyDest is potentially captured, there may be accesses to it from</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     another thread. In this case, we need to check that cpyStore is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     guaranteed to be executed if C is. As it is a non-atomic access, it</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     renders accesses from other threads undefined.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//     TODO: This is currently not checked.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="#a0c90ca0636305936b0f39e94b9702ec7">mayBeVisibleThroughUnwinding</a>(cpyDest, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#ac6aa1387c4375260e2468eb5a77fdb4cafd841a49aec1539bc88abc8ff9e170fb">C</a>, cpyStore)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check that dest points to memory that is at least as aligned as src.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/hsamd/kernel/arg/key/#a6b334a5f83504ebc99cc59f4f333ff98">Align</a> srcAlign = srcAlloca-&gt;getAlign();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00960" /><CodeLine lineNumber="960"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00961" /><CodeLine lineNumber="961"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check that src is not accessed except via the call and the memcpy.  This</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00982" /><CodeLine lineNumber="982"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00983" /><CodeLine lineNumber="983"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check whether src is captured by the called function, in which case there</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00989" /><CodeLine lineNumber="989"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00990" /><CodeLine lineNumber="990"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If src is captured, then check whether there are any potential uses of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00991" /><CodeLine lineNumber="991"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// src through the captured pointer before the lifetime of src ends, either</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00993" /><CodeLine lineNumber="993"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (SrcIsCaptured) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00994" /><CodeLine lineNumber="994"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check that dest is not captured before/at the call. We have already</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1022"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (&amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> == cpyLoad)</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1024"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1025"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check whether this instruction may mod/ref src through the captured</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1026"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// pointer (we have already any direct mod/refs in the loop above).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1027"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Also bail if we hit a terminator, as we don&#39;t want to scan into other</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1165"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (MForwardOffset &gt; 0) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1186"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Verify that the copied-from memory doesn&#39;t change in between the two</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1187"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// transfers.  For example, in:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1188"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//    memcpy(a &lt;- b)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1191"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// It would be invalid to transform the second memcpy into memcpy(c &lt;- b).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1192"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1193"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: If the code between M and MDep is transparent to the destination &quot;c&quot;,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="#ab06d3147949b764919b5ad90014afdfd">writtenBetween</a>(MSSA, BAA, MCopyLoc, MSSA-&gt;getMemoryAccess(MDep),</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// No need to create &#96;memcpy(a &lt;- a)&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (BAA.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults/#ab9ba3a606a0299b684755f56b1d2f1c7">isMustAlias</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getDest(), CopySource)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><Highlight kind="normal">    eraseInstruction(M);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1205"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1206"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1207"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the dest of the second might alias the source of the first, then the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1208"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// source and dest might overlap. In addition, if the source of the first</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01222" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1222"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If all checks passed, then we can transform M.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01226" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1226"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01227" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1227"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: Is this worth it if we&#39;re creating a less aligned memcpy? For</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01229" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1229"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/sandboxir/#a75d3582b0f0bc7a5123de92ada301e97">Instruction</a> &#42;NewM;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1231"><Highlight kind="normal">    NewM =</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1234"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;MemCpyInlineInst&gt;</a>(M)) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1235"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// llvm.memcpy may be promoted to llvm.memcpy.inline, but the converse is</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1236"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// never allowed since that would allow the latter to be lowered as a call</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1237"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to an external function.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1238"><Highlight kind="normal">    NewM = Builder.CreateMemCpyInline(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getDest(), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getDestAlign(),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1239"><Highlight kind="normal">                                      CopySource, CopySourceAlign,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1240"><Highlight kind="normal">                                      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getLength(), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;isVolatile());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1241"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">else</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1242"><Highlight kind="normal">    NewM =</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1243"><Highlight kind="normal">        Builder.CreateMemCpy(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getDest(), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getDestAlign(), CopySource,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1244"><Highlight kind="normal">                             CopySourceAlign, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getLength(), <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;isVolatile());</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1245"><Highlight kind="normal">  NewM-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#aec6eaa1e49f48c178e0ab9c030b5971e">copyMetadata</a>(&#42;M, LLVMContext::MD&#95;DIAssignID);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1246"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1247"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a92ca992e52dddc420f4b069cae06dfbe">isa&lt;MemoryDef&gt;</a>(MSSA-&gt;getMemoryAccess(M)));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1248"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;LastDef = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;MemoryDef&gt;</a>(MSSA-&gt;getMemoryAccess(M));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1249"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;NewAccess = MSSAU-&gt;createMemoryAccessAfter(NewM, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">, LastDef);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1250"><Highlight kind="normal">  MSSAU-&gt;insertDef(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac4fc845f5ed92de63cd4474f128f5fc5">cast&lt;MemoryDef&gt;</a>(NewAccess), </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;RenameUses=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1251"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1253"><Highlight kind="normal">  eraseInstruction(M);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1256"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1257"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1258"><Highlight kind="comment">/// We&#39;ve found that the (upward scanning) memory dependence of \\p MemCpy is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1259"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\p MemSet.  Try to simplify \\p MemSet to only set the trailing bytes that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1260"><Highlight kind="comment">/// weren&#39;t copied over by \\p MemCpy.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1261"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1262"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In other words, transform:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1263"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1264"><Highlight kind="comment">///   memset(dst, c, dst&#95;size);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1265"><Highlight kind="comment">///   ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1266"><Highlight kind="comment">///   memcpy(dst, src, src&#95;size);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1267"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1268"><Highlight kind="comment">/// into:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1269"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1270"><Highlight kind="comment">///   ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1271"><Highlight kind="comment">///   memset(dst + src&#95;size, c, dst&#95;size &lt;= src&#95;size ? 0 : dst&#95;size - src&#95;size);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1272"><Highlight kind="comment">///   memcpy(dst, src, src&#95;size);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1273"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1274"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1275"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The memset is sunk to just before the memcpy to ensure that src&#95;size is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1276"><Highlight kind="comment">/// present when emitting the simplified memset.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1277"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MemCpyOptPass::processMemSetMemCpyDependence(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memcpyinst">MemCpyInst</a> &#42;MemCpy,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1278"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memsetinst">MemSetInst</a> &#42;MemSet,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1279"><Highlight kind="normal">                                                  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a> &amp;BAA) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1280"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can only transform memset/memcpy with the same destination.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1281"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!BAA.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults/#ab9ba3a606a0299b684755f56b1d2f1c7">isMustAlias</a>(MemSet-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memintrinsicbase/#a44f399ae5b08171d0b9886d0a27a582a">getDest</a>(), MemCpy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memintrinsicbase/#a44f399ae5b08171d0b9886d0a27a582a">getDest</a>()))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1282"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1283"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1284"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Don&#39;t perform the transform if src&#95;size may be zero. In that case, the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1285"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// transform is essentially a complex no-op and may lead to an infinite</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1286"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// loop if BasicAA is smart enough to understand that dst and dst + src&#95;size</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1287"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// are still MustAlias after the transform.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1288"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a> &#42;SrcSize = MemCpy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memintrinsicbase/#a0fef04103987e9763468d19eb680b223">getLength</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1289"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9893e3e4b14f8fa15d7c3c25a6a0b6f6">isKnownNonZero</a>(SrcSize,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1290"><Highlight kind="normal">                      SimplifyQuery(MemCpy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#af65afd02332c4f21c2fab7d217d6600f">getDataLayout</a>(), DT, AC, MemCpy)))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1291"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1292"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1293"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check that src and dst of the memcpy aren&#39;t the same. While memcpy</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1294"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// operands cannot partially overlap, exact equality is allowed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1295"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a728f79528ca8659e15d00c1e6818b316">isModSet</a>(BAA.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults/#adfa0be41805b25d9577d6f15d148a0d7">getModRefInfo</a>(MemCpy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation/#a207e239d68b66b0d5ccad5997a5ef027">MemoryLocation::getForSource</a>(MemCpy))))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1296"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1298"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We know that dst up to src&#95;size is not written. We now need to make sure</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1299"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that dst up to dst&#95;size is not accessed. (If we did not move the memset,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1300"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// checking for reads would be sufficient.)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1301"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="#a732b03e0a47de172531cbae6e0ae0193">accessedBetween</a>(BAA, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorylocation/#ac8f8983c6b76d0e30f22fff86b281f16">MemoryLocation::getForDest</a>(MemSet),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1302"><Highlight kind="normal">                      MSSA-&gt;getMemoryAccess(MemSet),</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1304"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1306"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Use the same i8&#42; dest as the memcpy, killing the memset dest if different.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1320"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// By default, create an unaligned memset.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1322"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If Dest is aligned, and SrcSize is constant, use the minimum alignment</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1323"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// of the sum.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1331"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1337"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(MemSet-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-detail/node-parent-access/#a7e19e7508415378ad9523e0339b23e22">getParent</a>() == MemCpy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ilist-detail/node-parent-access/#a7e19e7508415378ad9523e0339b23e22">getParent</a>() &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1339"><Highlight kind="normal">  Builder.SetCurrentDebugLocation(MemSet-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction/#a4b8faae4ff9e7434a1d226d03d15dcd2">getDebugLoc</a>());</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1407"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Transform memcpy to memset when its source was just memset.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1408"><Highlight kind="comment">/// In other words, turn:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1409"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1410"><Highlight kind="comment">///   memset(dst1, c, dst1&#95;size);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1411"><Highlight kind="comment">///   memcpy(dst2, dst1, dst2&#95;size);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1412"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1413"><Highlight kind="comment">/// into:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1414"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1415"><Highlight kind="comment">///   memset(dst1, c, dst1&#95;size);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1416"><Highlight kind="comment">///   memset(dst2, c, dst2&#95;size);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1417"><Highlight kind="comment">/// \\endcode</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1418"><Highlight kind="comment">/// When dst2&#95;size &lt;= dst1&#95;size.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1419"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MemCpyOptPass::performMemCpyToMemSetOptzn(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memcpyinst">MemCpyInst</a> &#42;MemCpy,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1420"><Highlight kind="normal">                                               <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memsetinst">MemSetInst</a> &#42;MemSet,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1421"><Highlight kind="normal">                                               <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a> &amp;BAA) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1422"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make sure that memcpy(..., memset(...), ...), that is we are memsetting and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1423"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// memcpying from the same address. Otherwise it is hard to reason about.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1424"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!BAA.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults/#ab9ba3a606a0299b684755f56b1d2f1c7">isMustAlias</a>(MemSet-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memintrinsicbase/#a18d6accbeb5cb7b8051219b8b4ddd4f7">getRawDest</a>(), MemCpy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memtransferbase/#aa3c771310b66362b6a032071f63776bb">getRawSource</a>()))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1425"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1426"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1429"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1430"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (MemSetSize != CopySize) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1431"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make sure the memcpy doesn&#39;t read any more than what the memset wrote.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1444"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the memcpy is larger than the memset, but the memory was undef prior</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1445"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to the memset, we can just ignore the tail. Technically we&#39;re only</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01450" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1450"><Highlight kind="normal">      MemoryUseOrDef &#42;MemSetAccess = MSSA-&gt;getMemoryAccess(MemSet);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01451" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1451"><Highlight kind="normal">      MemoryAccess &#42;Clobber = MSSA-&gt;getWalker()-&gt;getClobberingMemoryAccess(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1453"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">auto</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;MD = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a22eeee01734061ac1b31ccd994c49eef">dyn&#95;cast&lt;MemoryDef&gt;</a>(Clobber))</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01454" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1454"><Highlight kind="normal">        </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="#a781cb075ecf323c9670d5695db656718">hasUndefContents</a>(MSSA, BAA, MemCpy-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memtransferbase/#aaebde92913b64b73fa77dd6e8767d9d9">getSource</a>(), MD, CopySize))</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01459" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1459"><Highlight kind="normal">      CopySize = MemSetSize;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01460" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1460"><Highlight kind="normal">    &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1473"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1474"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Attempts to optimize the pattern whereby memory is copied from an alloca to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1475"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// another alloca, where the two allocas don&#39;t have conflicting mod/ref. If</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1476"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// successful, the two allocas can be merged into one and the transfer can be</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1477"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// deleted. This pattern is generated frequently in Rust, due to the ubiquity of</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1478"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// move operations in that language.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1479"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1480"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Once we determine that the optimization is safe to perform, we replace all</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1481"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// uses of the destination alloca with the source alloca. We also &quot;shrink wrap&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1482"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// the lifetime markers of the single merged alloca to before the first use</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1483"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// and after the last use. Note that the &quot;shrink wrapping&quot; procedure is a safe</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1484"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// transformation only because we restrict the scope of this optimization to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1485"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// allocas that aren&#39;t captured.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1486"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MemCpyOptPass::performStackMoveOptzn(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;Load, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42;Store,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1487"><Highlight kind="normal">                                          <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/allocainst">AllocaInst</a> &#42;DestAlloca,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1488"><Highlight kind="normal">                                          <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/allocainst">AllocaInst</a> &#42;SrcAlloca, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/typesize">TypeSize</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1489"><Highlight kind="normal">                                          <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/batchaaresults">BatchAAResults</a> &amp;BAA) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1492"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1493"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Make sure the two allocas are in the same address space.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01708" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1708"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Perform simplification of memcpy&#39;s.  If we have memcpy A</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01709" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1709"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which copies X to Y, and memcpy B which copies Y to Z, then we can rewrite</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01710" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1710"><Highlight kind="comment">/// B to be a memcpy from X to Z (or potentially a memmove, depending on</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01711" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1711"><Highlight kind="comment">/// circumstances). This allows later passes to remove the first memcpy</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01712" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1712"><Highlight kind="comment">/// altogether.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01713" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1713"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MemCpyOptPass::processMemCpy(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memcpyinst">MemCpyInst</a> &#42;M, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#a98c0a84a5dfa8bce341c829709f171e5">BasicBlock::iterator</a> &amp;BBI) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01714" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1714"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We can only optimize non-volatile memcpy&#39;s.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01715" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1715"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;isVolatile())</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01716" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1716"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01717" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1717"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01718" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1718"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the source and destination of the memcpy are the same, then zap it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1719"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getSource() == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getDest()) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1720"><Highlight kind="normal">    ++BBI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01721" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1721"><Highlight kind="normal">    eraseInstruction(M);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01722" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1722"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01723" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1723"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01724" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1724"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01725" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1725"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If the size is zero, remove the memcpy.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01726" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1726"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (<a href="#a130464930fd75a2a4cc3c7f2179a5a1a">isZeroSize</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/arm/#ac2456158e5acb44477d8ecfa2d04dbdea69691c7bdcc3ce6d5d8a1361f22d04ac">M</a>-&gt;getLength())) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01727" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1727"><Highlight kind="normal">    ++BBI;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01728" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1728"><Highlight kind="normal">    eraseInstruction(M);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01729" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1729"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">true</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
